description: Basal cell carcinoma is a type of skin cancer that begins in the basal cells, which are responsible for producing new skin cells. It is the most common form of skin cancer, typically appearing as a waxy bump or a flat, flesh-colored or brown scar-like lesion.
possible causes: Excessive exposure to ultraviolet (UV) radiation from the sun or tanning beds
symptoms: A flat, flesh-colored or brown scar-like lesion
A bleeding or oozing sore that doesn't heal
